commands.name: cd
commands.description: Change the current working directory to the specified path. If no directory is specified, changes to the user's home directory.

commands.name: pwd
commands.description: Display the absolute path of the current working directory.

commands.name: echo
commands.description: Print the given arguments to standard output. Supports variable expansion using $VAR or ${VAR} syntax.

commands.name: export
commands.description: Set a shell variable and export it to child processes. Variables are available to all executed commands.

options.help: Variable name and value to export

commands.name: set
commands.description: Set a shell-local variable that is only available within the shell, not exported to child processes.

options.help: Variable name and value to set

commands.name: unset
commands.description: Delete a shell variable or environment variable.

commands.name: env
commands.description: List all currently set environment variables and their values.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Show detailed help information about the shell, including all built-in commands, features, and usage examples.

commands.name: version
commands.description: Display the shell version number and build details.

commands.name: history
commands.description: Display the list of previously executed commands from the current and past sessions.

commands.name: edi
commands.description: Modal text editor with normal, insert, and command modes. Similar to vi/vim but simplified for the shell.

commands.name: exit
commands.description: Terminate the shell session and return to the parent process.

commands.name: jobs
commands.description: Display information about background and stopped jobs.

options.help: Long format with PID and status

commands.name: fg
commands.description: Resume a background or stopped job in the foreground. Job can be specified by job number using %n syntax.

commands.name: bg
commands.description: Resume a stopped job in the background. Job can be specified by job number using %n syntax.

options.help: Job number (default: most recent stopped job)

commands.name: apt
commands.description: Local package management system similar to Debian's APT. Supports package installation, removal, searching, and dependency resolution.

options.help: One of: init, update, list, search, show, install, remove, verify

commands.name: apt init
commands.description: Create and initialize the local package repository database.

commands.name: apt update
commands.description: Refresh the local package database with latest package information.

commands.name: apt list
commands.description: Display all packages available in the repository.

commands.name: apt search
commands.description: Search package names and descriptions for the given pattern.

options.help: Search pattern to match against package names and descriptions

commands.name: apt show
commands.description: Display detailed information about a specific package, including version, dependencies, and description.

options.help: Package name to show details for

commands.name: apt install
commands.description: Install a package and its dependencies. Use --auto-install to automatically install dependencies without prompting.

commands.name: apt remove
commands.description: Uninstall a package. Use --force to bypass warnings about dependent packages.

options.help: Force removal even if other packages depend on it

commands.name: apt verify
commands.description: Check the integrity of installed packages and report any issues.

commands.name: myls
commands.description: Custom implementation of ls command to display files and directories in the specified path.

commands.name: mycat
commands.description: Read and display the contents of one or more files to standard output.

options.help: One or more files to display

commands.name: mycp
commands.description: Copy a file from source to destination. Creates destination file with same contents as source.

commands.name: mymv
commands.description: Move a file to a new location or rename it.

commands.name: myrm
commands.description: Delete one or more files from the filesystem.

options.help: One or more files to remove

commands.name: mymkdir
commands.description: Create one or more new directories.

options.help: One or more directories to create

commands.name: myrmdir
commands.description: Delete one or more empty directories. Fails if directory contains files.

options.help: One or more empty directories to remove

commands.name: mytouch
commands.description: Create new empty files or update the timestamp of existing files.

options.help: One or more files to create or touch

commands.name: mystat
commands.description: Show detailed information about files including size, permissions, timestamps, and inode data.

options.help: One or more files to display status for

commands.name: myfd
commands.description: Search for files matching a pattern in the specified directory and its subdirectories.

commands.name: ls
commands.description: Standard system ls command for listing files and directories.

commands.name: cat
commands.description: Standard system cat command for displaying file contents.

commands.name: grep
commands.description: Search for patterns in files using regular expressions.

commands.name: find
commands.description: Search for files in a directory hierarchy based on various criteria.

commands.name: wc
commands.description: Count lines, words, and characters in files.
